article.title: Less-Expensive Valuation of Long Term Annuities Linked to Mortality, Cash and Equity

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Figure 1 illustrate about the S&P500 total return index when discounted by the savings account?
choices: The discounted index value remains relatively stable over time.
The discounted index value exhibits a clear upward trend over the long term.
The discounted index value shows a consistent downward trend throughout the entire period.
The discounted index value follows a cyclical pattern with no discernible long-term trend.

multiple_choice_question.text: What relationship does Figure 2 demonstrate between the S&P500 and the savings account?
choices: The S&P500 and savings account have identical growth rates over the long term.
The S&P500 exhibits a lower long-term growth rate than the savings account.
The S&P500 exhibits a higher long-term growth rate than the savings account.
The growth rates of the S&P500 and savings account are completely uncorrelated.

multiple_choice_question.text: What observation about the putative risk-neutral measure\'s density process can be made from Figure 3?
choices: The density process appears to be a true martingale with no clear trend.
The density process exhibits a clear upward trend over the long term.
The density process exhibits a clear downward trend over the long term, suggesting it may be a strict supermartingale.
The density process follows a cyclical pattern with no discernible long-term trend.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Figure 4 demonstrate about the behavior of savings bonds and fair zero coupon bonds over time?
choices: Both savings bonds and fair zero coupon bonds show similar long-term trends.
Savings bonds consistently outperform fair zero coupon bonds in terms of value growth.
Fair zero coupon bonds consistently outperform savings bonds in terms of value growth.
The values of savings bonds and fair zero coupon bonds are completely uncorrelated.
The actuarial valuation formula for a contingent claim.
The risk-neutral valuation formula for a contingent claim.
The real world valuation formula for a contingent claim, utilizing the benchmark portfolio and real-world probability measure.
The formula for calculating the expected present value of a contingent claim.
